description:
Seeking for revenge, Count Saazbaum, a Martian, attacked the Earth. Later on, the war between the Terrans and Martians ended with Earth's Terrans gaining the victory. However, nineteen months later, the battle between them continues. Martians still continues to invade the Earth and the Terrans to protect it.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Space Opera
tags.description: Centers around space warfare, advanced technology, chivalric romance and adventure.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Netorare
tags.description: Netorare is what happens when the protagonist gets their partner stolen from them by someone else. It is a sexual fetish designed to cause sexual jealousy by way of having the partner indulge in sexual activity with someone other than the protagonist.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ei_aoki)

Ei Aoki is a Japanese storyboard artist and director. He credits the anime Megazone 23 as his inspiration to have a career in animation. In 2013, he created the animation studio Troyca with Toshiyuki Nagano and Tomonobu Kato, which began animation production on its first work in the fall of 2014.

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Butch_Gen)

Gen Urobuchi is a Japanese novelist and screenwriter. He is a key member of the video game and visual novel developer [Nitroplus](https://anilist.co/studio/459/Nitroplus) and currently serves as the company's representative director and vice-president.

He is best known as the co-creator of the highly acclaimed and commercially successful anime series [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Puella-Magi-Madoka-Magica/), which earned him the Tokyo Anime Award for Best Scriptwriter. His other major works include the acclaimed Nitroplus-developed visual novel, *Saya no Uta*, the anime series [PSYCHO-PASS](https://anilist.co/anime/13601/PSYCHOPASS/), the light novel and anime series [Fate/Zero](https://anilist.co/anime/10087/FateZero/), and the tokusatsu TV show *Kamen Rider Gaim*. Urobuchi is one of the most renowned and prolific writers in the anime industry.

Anime series written by Urobuchi that have won the Newtype Anime Award have been Puella Magi Madoka Magica in 2011, Fate/Zero in 2012 and [Psycho-Pass: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/20514/PSYCHOPASS-The-Movie/) in 2015.

A film buff, Urobuchi likes to include film homages in his works. He has named Kiyoshi Kurosawa, Sergio Leone, and John Carpenter to be his favorite directors. As a child, he also loved robot animation and cited [Armored Trooper Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/Armored-Trooper-Votoms/) as one of his influences.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Phantom -PHANTOM OF INFERNO- (Visual Novel, 2000) (Scenario)
- Vampirdzhija Vjedogonia (Visual Novel, 2001) (Director, Scenario)
- Kikokugai: The Cyber Slayer (Visual Novel, 2002) (Director, Scenario)
- "Hello, world." (Visual Novel, 2002) (Original Concept, Planning, Debug)
- Deus Machina Demonbane (Visual Novel, 2003) (Director)
- Saya no Uta ~ The Song of Saya (Visual Novel, 2003) (Director, Scenario)
- Zoku Satsuriku no Django -Jigoku no Shoukinkubi- (Visual Novel, 2007) (Scenario, Planning)
- Kamen Rider Gaim (Tokusatsu, TV series, 2013) (Series Composition, Script)
- Thunderbolt Fantasy (TV series, 2016) (Original Creator, Chief Supervision, Script)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takakoshimura) | [Official Website](https://lit.link/en/takakoshimura)

Takako Shimura is a female manga artist primarily known for her manga works published in Japan which feature LGBT  (especially about lesbian and transgender) topics. Originally from Kanagawa, she now resides in Tokyo.

[Official Website ](https://www.aoieir.com/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/eir_ruru) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZ7B1oCEDT_d4c9XTtChX7w) | [Instagram ](https://www.instagram.com/aoieir/) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/18moNotPmBWa2YZtRnIoZ3?autoplay=true)

Aoi Eir is a Japanese pop singer signed to SME Records. She was discovered through Nico Nico Douga video sharing network. Like other Nico Nico Douga artists, not much of her personal information is revealed.   

Eir has loved singing since she was a child, at high school period, she sung in a band she had formed. After graduating from high school, she gave up her music career but continued performing publicly. Her impressive and beautiful voice are easily recognizable and she has been selected to sing the closing song for TV animation “Fate/Zero” which was released as her debut single called “MEMORIA” on October 19, 2011.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ei_aoki)

Ei Aoki is a Japanese storyboard artist and director. He credits the anime Megazone 23 as his inspiration to have a career in animation. In 2013, he created the animation studio Troyca with Toshiyuki Nagano and Tomonobu Kato, which began animation production on its first work in the fall of 2014.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ei_aoki)

Ei Aoki is a Japanese storyboard artist and director. He credits the anime Megazone 23 as his inspiration to have a career in animation. In 2013, he created the animation studio Troyca with Toshiyuki Nagano and Tomonobu Kato, which began animation production on its first work in the fall of 2014.

__Height:__ 160 cm

[Website](http://www.amamiyasora.jp/) | [Profile](http://musicrayn.com/amamiya_sora) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/amamiyasorablog/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCc4xpujLxnUBSI1XX-SdldQ) | [Second YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2oaLFNojVzLwQaA5KJOy3g) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Amamiyastaff) 

While a sophomore in high school, Amamiya was introduced to a video collection of roles of voice actress [Miyuki Sawashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/95099). Following this, Amamiya decided to become a voice actress.

Amamiya, together with [Momo Asakura](https://anilist.co/staff/118479) and [Shiina Natsukawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118818), passed an audition held by Music Ray'n in 2011, with the three making their voice acting debut in 2012. She made her official music debut for Music Ray'n by performing Akame ga Kill's opening theme "Skyreach." In late 2014, Amamiya, Asakura, and Natsukawa formed the music unit [TrySail](https://anilist.co/staff/144938/), which released its first single "Youthful Dreamer," used as the opening theme to the anime television series Ultimate Otaku Teacher, on May 13, 2015.

Amamiya, together with [Reina Ueda](https://anilist.co/staff/118602) and [Aya Suzaki](https://anilist.co/staff/114834), received the Best New Actress award at the 9th Seiyu Awards in March 2015.


__Non-Anime Roles:__

An art director and the representative director of Studio Ara.
